page.title: 13MOVERONS FARMS/LANDSCAPE
page.content: Running roughly north to south along the east bank of the River Colne is the course of a disused railway.Here are found many interesting grasses such as meadow oat grass and velvet bent.Flowers also grow here,like weld and the pretty lady's bedstraw which have yellow flowers. Rabbits,yellow hammers and some shy partridges live along the track. A pit full of water,site of a Roman villa sadly destroyed by gravel extraction,attracts swans,hordes of damsel-flies,some Canada geese and a few mallard ducks.Dragonflies hover over the water,and midges abound,while skylarks sing,and sandmartins,from nests in the gravel workings nearby, swing overhead.
